Detailed Description

A basic property for a DNS-SD service.

This class implements the basic properties for a service as defined in the DNS-SD documentation. It works using a real memory image of the final data : a 255 bytes buffer containing both name and optional value for the property. The first byte contains the full length of this property.

The ServiceProperties class is declared as a friend class of ServiceProperty. Thus, it can access to the private and protected members.

Definition at line 56 of file ServiceProperties.h.

Member Function Documentation

void ServiceProperty::Empty (  ) 

Empty a property.

This function empty a property. The Length is set to 1 (just the byte containing the length of the property), the intinsect BinaryLength of the property (the only byte) is set to 0 as the NameLength and the ValueLength.

In debug mode, we also full the Hash with 0.

bool ServiceProperty::SetProperty ( const SimpleString  Name,
const SimpleString  Value = SimpleString::EmptyString 
) [virtual]

Set name and optionaly value for a property.

Parameters:
[in] Name a const c-SimpleString containing the property name.
[in] Value an optional const c-SimpleString containing the value of the property
Returns:
a boolean answer if changes are made.
This function changes name and optionaly value for a property. If a problem occurs, the property remains unchanged. You can define property as follow:
  • if Name equals "Property" and Value is NULL, we will have a flag : "Property".
  • if Name equals "Property" and Value is "", we will have an empty property : "Property=".
  • if Name equals "Property" and Value is "something", we will have : "Property=something".

Reimplemented in Omiscid::ServicePropertyNotify.
